title: NASA Begins Next Phase Of Moon to Mars Exploration Architecture Development
summary: Its been three months since NASA unveiled its "Moon to Mars" Exploration Architecture plans for human exploration and now the agency is gearing up for the crucial second phase that will focus on missions to Mars.

title: Astranis internet satellite malfunctions before beginning Alaska service, backup planned for spring
summary: Satellite internet service provider Astranis said Friday its first commercial satellite in orbit, which was intended to provide coverage to Alaska, has malfunctioned. A backup satellite is planned for the spring.

title: First Astranis satellite sidelined by post-deployment glitch
summary: The first Astranis-built satellite won’t be able to provide commercial broadband over Alaska for local telco Pacific Dataport because it can’t keep solar arrays pointed at the sun, the Californian manufacturer’s CEO John Gedmark said July 20.

title: Louisiana Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
summary: As part of the state’s first Earth-to-space call, students from Louisiana will have an opportunity soon to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: Amazon to build $120 million facility in Florida to prep Kuiper internet satellites for launch
summary: Amazon will invest $120 million to build a satellite processing facility at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, as the company prepares to launch the first satellites for its Project Kuiper internet network, the tech giant announced Friday.

title: NASA emphasizes climate science role amid fiscal and partisan challenges
summary: In a summer of extreme weather events, NASA is emphasizing its role in studying the climate, efforts that face both fiscal headwinds and partisan divides.

title: Rocket Report: Space Force to pick three; Pythom strikes back
summary: "With this mission we’ve made big strides toward reusability."

title: NASA moving into next phase of exploration architecture review
summary: Three months after rolling out the first phase of its architecture for human exploration of the moon and Mars, NASA is heading into a second phase that will focus on Mars.

title: Pew Poll: Americans Want Space Program to Focus on Asteroids and Climate More Than Human Spaceflight
summary: The latest poll from the Pew Research Center once again found that by a wide margin Americans want the space program to focus more on the threat from asteroids and […]

title: Booster 9 rolls to the upgraded Starbase pad ahead of Static Fire test
summary: Booster 9 has arrived at the Orbital Launch Site ahead of a Static Fire test, which will also be used to validate repairs and upgrades of Starship’s launch pad. That rollout is a key milestone in the campaign ahead of the second flight of the world’s most powerful rocket.
